meanings.definition: A person or thing that gives rise to an action, phenomenon, or condition.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was the cause of the dog barking.
meanings.sent2: The cause of the traffic jam was a car accident.
meanings.sent3: The cause of the laughter in the room was a funny joke.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the cause of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The cause of the problem was a leaky pipe.

meanings.definition: To bring about or give rise to.
meanings.sent1: Eating too much candy can cause a stomachache.
meanings.sent2: The storm may cause delays in the flight schedule.
meanings.sent3: His silly dance moves cause laughter among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news caused a stir in the office.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting cause joy in viewers.
